headline: Stocks to Watch Recap: Electronic Arts, Lockheed Martin, Carnival, Alibaba
summary: ↗️ Electronic Arts (EA): The videogame maker is going private for $52.5 billion in what it billed as the largest-ever private-equity backed buyout. Shares rose 4.5% Monday, while other video-game stocks such as Roblox (RBLX) and Take-Two Interactive Software (TTWO) also moved higher on the day.

headline: CSX railroad replaces CEO after investor pressure and poor performance as Union Pacific merger looms
summary: CSX railroad announced Monday that it had replaced its CEO less than two months after an investment fund urged it to either find another railroad to merge with to better compete with the proposed transcontinental Union Pacific railroad or fire outgoing CEO Joe Hinrichs.  Hinrichs resigned to clear the way for Steve Angel to become CEO effective Sunday.  CSX said he has 45 years experience leading large public companies, including most recently as CEO of Linde and Praxair that provide industrial gasses to other companies.

content.title: CSX railroad replaces CEO after investor pressure and poor performance as Union Pacific merger looms
content.summary: CSX railroad announced Monday that it had replaced its CEO less than two months after an investment fund urged it to either find another railroad to merge with to better compete with the proposed transcontinental Union Pacific railroad or fire outgoing CEO Joe Hinrichs.  Hinrichs resigned to clear the way for Steve Angel to become CEO effective Sunday.  CSX said he has 45 years experience leading large public companies, including most recently as CEO of Linde and Praxair that provide industrial gasses to other companies.

headline: EA to go private, CSX CEO, cannabis stocks: Trending Tickers
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including video game studio Electronic Arts (EA) agreeing to go private after agreeing to a deal valued at up to $55 billion, CSX (CSX) CEO Joe Hinrichs has abruptly left the company, and cannabis stocks like Tilray Brands (TLRY), Cronos Group (CRON), and Canopy Growth (CGC) getting a lift higher after President Trump touted CBD health benefits for senior citizens. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: CSX Appoints New CEO Following Activist Pressure
summary: CSX named Steve Angel as its chief executive, succeeding Joe Hinrichs, after activist investor Ancora Holdingstold the railroad operator that it should pursue a deal with a rival.

content.title: CSX Appoints New CEO Following Activist Pressure
content.summary: CSX named Steve Angel as its chief executive, succeeding Joe Hinrichs, after activist investor Ancora Holdingstold the railroad operator that it should pursue a deal with a rival.

headline: CSX appoints Steve Angel as CEO amid activist pressure
summary: Shares of the company rose about 3.5% in morning trading.  The announcement comes as CSX has faced activist pressure from Ancora Holdings to pursue merger options to replace Hinrichs.  Angel brings on more than four decades of experience, including at Linde plc and 22 years at General Electric, where he was involved in locomotive and rail operations.

content.title: CSX appoints Steve Angel as CEO amid activist pressure
content.summary: Shares of the company rose about 3.5% in morning trading.  The announcement comes as CSX has faced activist pressure from Ancora Holdings to pursue merger options to replace Hinrichs.  Angel brings on more than four decades of experience, including at Linde plc and 22 years at General Electric, where he was involved in locomotive and rail operations.

thumbnail.caption: A CSX freight train travels in Washington

headline: CSX appoints new CEO as US railroad operator battles activist pressure
summary: (Reuters) -CSX Corp has named veteran executive Steve Angel its CEO, replacing Joe Hinrichs, as the U.S. railroad operator fends off pressure from an activist investor against the backdrop of rapid consolidation in the industry.  He became the chair in 2022 after he stepped down from the CEO role.  Since Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern's surprise $85 billion merger in the industry's largest-ever buyout, there has been mounting speculation about more big mergers, including one involving CSX.

content.title: CSX appoints new CEO as US railroad operator battles activist pressure
content.summary: (Reuters) -CSX Corp has named veteran executive Steve Angel its CEO, replacing Joe Hinrichs, as the U.S. railroad operator fends off pressure from an activist investor against the backdrop of rapid consolidation in the industry.  He became the chair in 2022 after he stepped down from the CEO role.  Since Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern's surprise $85 billion merger in the industry's largest-ever buyout, there has been mounting speculation about more big mergers, including one involving CSX.

headline: 1 S&P 500 Stock for Long-Term Investors and 2 We Avoid
summary: The S&P 500 (^GSPC) is home to the biggest and most well-known companies in the market, making it a go-to index for investors seeking stability. But not all large-cap stocks are created equal - some are struggling with slowing growth, declining margins, or increased competition.

content.title: 1 S&P 500 Stock for Long-Term Investors and 2 We Avoid
content.summary: The S&P 500 (^GSPC) is home to the biggest and most well-known companies in the market, making it a go-to index for investors seeking stability. But not all large-cap stocks are created equal - some are struggling with slowing growth, declining margins, or increased competition.
